content: CONGRATULATIONS to seniors Rachel Brake (French horn) and Emma Vieira (vocal) for being named 2018 Connecticut All-State Musicians.  On Saturday, February 3rd, both ladies successfully auditioned and competed against the best student musicians from all public and private high schools across the state.  Rachel and Emma will represent Christian Heritage School by performing as a part of the All-State Band and All-State Chorus respectively on Saturday, April 20th in Hartford!  #creativekingsmen #theCHSdifference #CTallstatemusicians

Our studio art students have joined the #MemoryProject, a charitable nonprofit organization that invites art teachers and their students to create and donate portraits to youth around the world who have faced substantial challenges, such as neglect, abuse, loss of parents, violence, and extreme poverty.   #compasion #GodsLove #theCHSdifference #artministry

photos.description: Students in Studio Art received photos of children who are waiting for portraits. They have worked in art class to create the portraits.  Now completed, the Memory Project delivers the portraits to the children.  In total, the students have made portraits for 9 children in Syria. #memoryproject #Godslove #artministry #theCHSdifference

content: Our Art students make lifelong gifts of portraits for vulnerable children. #memoryproject #compasion #GodsLove #theCHSdifference
"LOVE the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength." (Mark 12:30)  #happyvalentinesday
Happy 100th day of school from CHS class of 2030!

HAPPY 100th Day of School, everyone!  It was a really exciting day, thanks to our amazing first graders. Thank you, CHS Class of 2030, for sharing your creative #100thdayofschool projects! #thechsdifference

photos.description: No words...
The 100 day projects were some of the funniest and most creative we have seen! #chstraditions
It was evident that our studious first graders put a LOT of care and time into their projects! #futureleader
Parents came in to help with some special classroom projects. #wehavetheBESTparents
Don't you LOVE Katelyn's 100 ...umm, cottontails?!
Even our Seniors were really impressed with the 100 Day projects!
Noah worked with 100 pieces of Lego to create this impressive structure. #futurearchitect
Yes, those are exactly 100 button-eyes!
Now THIS was a precious project, for sure!
More buttons -- some were even popping!
CONGRATULATIONS to the class of 2030 for celebrating 100 days of the 2017-18 academic year! Who ever knew learning could be such FUN?!
...and another victorious photo on the way outside to recess.

content: CHS is taking part in the new SAT School Day program! This opportunity allows CHS juniors to take the SAT on campus Tuesday, April 24, 2018. Get a head start to college admissions preparation and a "home court" advantage!

content: Columbia Model Congress concluded on Sunday with one last full session for our congresspeople, one last trial for our Supreme Court attorneys, and one last Presidential Cabinet meeting for our Secretary of State. #modelcongress #columbiamodelcongress #thechsdifference

photos.description: It's been an inspiring, life-changing four days for all 15 CHS delegates, and as they wind down from this physically and mentally exhausting experience, we're excited to see how they'll use their new knowledge and insight to further enrich and serve the CHS community.

It's been an inspiring, life-changing four days for all 15 CHS delegates, and as they wind down from this physically and mentally exhausting experience, we're excited to see how they'll use their new knowledge and insight to further enrich and serve the CHS community.

It's been an inspiring, life-changing four days for all 15 CHS delegates, and as they wind down from this physically and mentally exhausting experience, we're excited to see how they'll use their new knowledge and insight to further enrich and serve the CHS community.

Congratulations! CHS Model Congress took the Outstanding Small Delegation award, beating out a number of other competing schools for this highly regarded recognition. #modelcongress #columbiamodelcongress #thechsdifference

Congratulations! CHS Model Congress took the Outstanding Small Delegation award, beating out a number of other competing schools for this highly regarded recognition. #modelcongress #columbiamodelcongress #thechsdifference

Congratulations! CHS Model Congress took the Outstanding Small Delegation award, beating out a number of other competing schools for this highly regarded recognition. #modelcongress #columbiamodelcongress #thechsdifference

It's been an inspiring, life-changing four days for all 15 CHS delegates, and as they wind down from this physically and mentally exhausting experience, we're excited to see how they'll use their new knowledge and insight to further enrich and serve the CHS community.

CONGRATULATIONS to Will Rojas for having the honor of being CHS' first individual Model Congress award recipient in its history, having won an honorable mention in his Foreign Affairs committee. And CHS also took the Outstanding Small Delegation award, beating out a number of other competing schools for this highly regarded recognition. #modelcongress #columbiamodelcongress #thechsdifference

content: CONGRATULATIONS, CHS #modelcongress!!! Outstanding small delegation at Columbia Model Congress! THANK YOU MS. LIU!  #theCHSdifference #modelcongress  #columbiamodelcongress
Day 3 of Columbia Model Congress is in the books! CHS students participated in eight solid hours of debate today.

photos.description: Highlights of today's sessions included several emergency crises on a variety of pressing topics: a space shuttle disaster, foreign election interference, as well as a human rights crisis in Myanmar that proved as diplomatically challenging as it was emotionally grueling. In a surprising turn of events, the Presidential Cabinet was even brought to trial in front of the Supreme Court today for their role in possibly interfering with a local election.

It was exciting to see our special programs delegates facing off against one another, with a standout performance by Joshua Sampson giving a witness testimony during the trial in his role as Secretary of State.

It was exciting to see our special programs delegates facing off against one another, with a standout performance by Joshua Sampson giving a witness testimony during the trial in his role as Secretary of State. We will be in session for just one more day, and will be reporting back from closing ceremonies tomorrow.

content: Catch up with us at Columbia Model Congress! Day 2 was an adventure-filled day as students spent some time exploring the city in the morning before kicking off an afternoon/evening filled with speeches and debate. A special CONGRATULATIONS to Julia Krebs and Tina Qin for winning their first Supreme Court case! Check out these photos of our students in action. #modelcongress  #columbiamodelcongress  #theCHSdifference

content: More awards were received this weekend for our fall sports teams.  Scott Taylor and Ranita Muriel were honored as Connecticut All State Soccer Players today.  The Girls Soccer team received the Connecticut Girls Soccer Coaches Association Sportsmanship Award for the 2nd season in a row.  The girls, who were 17-3-2, were also honored by the United Soccer Coaches as a Team Ethics and Sportsmanship Platinum Award recipient for receiving zero cards over the course of the season.  #goCHSkingsmen
